meanings.definition: Quops (verb): to make a sudden, sharp noise
meanings.sent1: The door quops loudly when it closes.
meanings.sent2: I heard a quops coming from the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The quops of the balloon popping made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The quops of thunder echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The quops of the drumbeat filled the room with energy.

meanings.sent1: The quops of the firecracker startled the cat.
meanings.sent2: I heard a quops in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected quops made us all laugh.
meanings.sent4: The quops of the car horn broke the silence of the night.
meanings.sent5: The quops of the hammer hitting the nail echoed in the room.

meanings.definition: Quops (adjective): describing something that makes a sudden, sharp noise
meanings.sent1: The quops sound of the alarm woke me up.
meanings.sent2: The quops toy kept the baby entertained.
meanings.sent3: The quops bird chirping outside was a pleasant sound.
meanings.sent4: The quops wind chimes added a calming atmosphere to the garden.
meanings.sent5: The quops engine noise signaled the start of the race.
